title: A copie of verses, said to be composed by his Majestie, upon his first imprisonment in the Isle of Wight
author: Brome, Alexander, 1620-1666.
notes: Not in fact by King Charles I, but a satire by Alexander Brome. Cf. Wing (2nd ed., 1994).
Verse -- "Imprison me ye traytors! Must I be".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
